Contradict fact: The claim that the photo shows a mosque built by Shakib Al Hasan contradicts the fact that the photo actually shows a railway station in Kharkiv, Ukraine.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or verification provided to prove that the photo is indeed of a mosque built by Shakib Al Hasan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo depicts a mosque built by Shakib Al Hasan based on a misleading caption and accompanying text, without verifying the facts.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the photo actually shows a railway station in Kharkiv, Ukraine, which is supported by evidence from reverse image searches and other sources.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by presenting a false narrative that Shakib Al Hasan and his wife built a mosque in his hometown, when in reality, the photo is unrelated to any mosque construction.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim as it falsely presents a mosque construction by Shakib Al Hasan.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing accurate information and misrepresenting the content of the photo.
Other biases: None of the other biases listed (Falters at times, Understate, Exaggerate) are applicable in this case.
